name: Sleep Inn

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay overnight after a reunion. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The room had a refrigerator and microwave. The room itself was average for a hotel but in good shape. The staff is what made this place shine. The young lady in the morning helped us with directions and the young man in the afternoon with a minor problem. If I ever return to Frederick I know where I can stay.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: I've stayed in this Sleep Inn before and as my daughter will be attending a local college in the fall, I expect I'll be staying here a lot more in the next four years. Sleep Inn's are a step below Comfort Inn/Suites in amenities. That being said, this one is very nice. The room and common areas are very clean, good mattress & pillows, and the showers are great. The front desk staff and the breakfast lady are professional and friendly. The only issue I have is that the eggs at breakfast are so-so. Other than that, it's a great place to stay at a reasonable price of $80. The area has lots of restaurants to choose from, and downtown Frederick (about 4 miles away) has some great restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel was easy to find with the address in my GPS, clean and comfortable. Free Breakfast was a little light but it was free. Lots of close by places for Dinner and to grab a quick breakfast on the go which is what we chose to do.
reviews.title: great room for the price

reviews.text: My future hubby and I stayed here on Memorial Day Weekend for a friend's wedding. We spent very little time in the room. The room was small and the bathroom was small,but everything was very clean and the staff was helpful. The king size bed was comfortable. It was not expensive and I feel we got our moneys worth. The only suggestion I would really have is to try and include more variety for breakfast. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Fine for the weekend

reviews.text: My husband I made a quick trip to the Frederick area June 8-June 9. Having previously stayed at the Sleep Inn, we stayed again and were just as satisfied as we had been before. We had a king-size bed: linens were clean and bed comfortable. The room was spotless. I really enjoyed the very quiet in-wall air conditioner unit (some hotels are sooo noisey!). We recommend this Sleep Inn and will return. One small negative: the breakfast selections are not impressive; however, the Double TT diner is just down the road!
reviews.title: Return stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very nice, clean place to stay. The staff was very helpful with any questions we presented to them. The room we stayed in smelled very clean, like new carpet, and the shower was the largest shower I have seen in a hotel room. I would highly recommend this for couples or family's. Fancy is not as important to me as staying at a safe, clean place with friendly staff. The cleaning staff was very prompt to clean our room to make it look as if it were the first time we were walking into it. I would highly recommend staying here. Lots of eating places within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.text: This is a very clean hotel and the front desk staff were very accommodating. Overall a nice hotel but not luxurious. They provide the absolute minimum number of towels and they are quite thin. Sheets were also quite thin. However everything was very clean which is important. The breakfast room was the smallest I have ever seen. A selection of cold cereal, bread, bagels, and pastries. And as many hard boiled eggs as you could eat. Quite good coffee and juices were available. There were apples, and oranges were brought out on request. Free wi-fi was also appreciated. The maid was banging on my door at 9 am totally ignoring my do not disturb sign though!
reviews.title: Clean standard lodging typical of a Sleep Inn

reviews.text: Not a fancy hotel by any means but it is clean and gives you a place to stay for the night. Pillows are uncomfortable though.
reviews.title: Does the job

reviews.text: I had a decent stay at the sleep inn on May 26 but totally forgot 2 personal items (phone chargers). The staff had indeed found my items but when I requested them to be sent to me, I was told to call the mailing company for the charge, which exceeded the cost of new chargers. I know for a fact thought experience that any of the Marriott chain hotels mail items back to the owners with no charge. Sleep Inn lacks in customer service.
reviews.title: Won't stay at a sleep inn again

reviews.text: Very clean, very neat, very quiet. Exit off Route 270, turn by the Sheetz gas station, and keep going straight. Drive past the little Francis Scott Key Mall and go all the way back. It's tucked in quietly after all the retail. You are only 50 minutes to an hour away from D.C. if you drive, or you can drive to the Shady Grove station and pick up the Metro Red line, it's less than $5.00 to leave your car there all day.
reviews.title: lots of motels in Frederick---pick this one

reviews.text: Sleep Inn has always been known as a good value with modest but functional furnishings. This suburban Washington DC property meets both criteria nicely. My family and I stayed four nights during a spring vacation at the nation's capital and enjoyed good beds each night and warm showers each morning. (Sleep Inn properties do not include baths.)
reviews.title: Modest digs in a great location

reviews.text: This hotel is 25 miles from the end of the Metro Rail's Red Line (Shady Grove station). That's a 30-minute drive to the Shady Grove station where you can park your car for a nominal $4.75 all day, and then 35 minutes more into Metro Center. So for a little more than one hour commute , you arrive downtown without worrying about parking and congestion, ready to tour the Washington monuments, museums, and the US Capitol. At the same time we avoided downtown and close by suburban hotels that cost two to three times as much each night.
reviews.title: Nice, clean place to stay, but needs some small improvements

reviews.text: This is also a great location because within three blocks you can dine at Ruby Tuesday, Red Robin, Applebees, Cracker Barrel, Golden Corral and PIzza Hut. (The last two are in walking distance). There's also a Mexican restaurant, a Chinese restaurant, as well as Roy Rogers, Wendy's, Burger King, and MickeyD's.
reviews.title: no media
A-OK, DOES THE JOB...
reviews.text: The morning continental breakfast includes pastries, boiled eggs, minidonuts, coffee, milk, juice, apples and oranges. Pretty sparse, and my wife, who enjoys bananas, was surprised to find none there. We ate all our breakfasts outside the hotel.

The hotel is well kept inside and out, and like most Sleep Inns, does not have a swimming pool. That shouldn't matter if you spend the day touring DC and come back late at night tired, ready to relax in front of the TV (25 inch with good picture and lots of cable stations including ESPN and ESPN2).
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: In mid-June we booked 2 nights ( last minute) at the Williamsburg Sleep Inn, but the night before we arrived the roof had been damaged in a lightening storm and on arrival we noticed the carpet in the lobby was torn up and there were some industrial fans going to air out the hotel. The front desk staff was very apologetic. On our way to our room we noticed a slight smoke( fire..not cigarette) odor, but it wasn't too bad. Halls were very clean with a fun geometric carpet pattern. We found the room a typical very tidy minimalist Sleep Inn. Carpet appeared newish..bedspreads looked clean..bath & sink area was very tidy and nice. Actually we were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the place since so many other Williamsburg hotels of higher quality & price had very bad reviews. We got a $72.00 AAA rate on the weekend!.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Hotel for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first trip to Williamsburg and didn't expect to have a hard time finding a reasonably priced room in September. Refusing to pay $120-$140 per night stopped by Sleep Inn. We asked to see a room before paying. Upon inspection it was clean and looked to have been recently renovated. The carpet was clean and in good condition. (I still were footwear). The beds were fine. Had two quiet nights. The cookies were ok and breakfast nothing special. The location was great. Very easy to get around. My only complaint would be the odor in the first floor hallway. It seemed to be coming from the laundry room but sure didn't smell like cleaning products. Once in the room you couldn't smell it however. For the price of $89 and $99 per night we'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Overall decent stay

likes.liked: — Price considering prices of other hotels

reviews.text: A customer In Virginia. On recent stay went to this motel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Great price

reviews.text: I liked the friendly staff. Need better pillows. The indoor pool
reviews.title: Suprisingly a really nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was nice not many people in it. The room was nice even had
reviews.title: underrated hotel

reviews.text: a refrig. They even made cookies for the guest at night.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

reviews.text: Good place to stay. Big comfortable clean room, large shower (no tub) with separate basin. Fridge, iron, decent coffee,and a Microwave which unfortunately wasn't working (but I didn't mention to front desk so they had no opportunity to rectify).
reviews.title: Good place to sleep!

likes.liked: — Spacious, clean, set back from road

reviews.text: One very important plus point about this property - the parking lot out front (which is nicely landscaped) is vast, and sets the property back at least 100 yards from the main road, so it is really quiet - good if like me you are a light sleeper. It's very close to Historic Williamsburg - no more than 1 minute drive away.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, clean hotel

reviews.text: I didn't try the indoor pool but it looked in good order. Breakfast was well presented - the usual mix, including cereal, toast, muffins, juice and waffles.
reviews.title: Decent place

reviews.text: Overall,a good experience, and at $72 incl tax, a bargain.
reviews.title: just average

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Sleep Inn. The hotel was clean (we didn't see any mold), the staff was friendly, the kids loved the indoor pool, and the hotel is located just a few minutes from the visitors' center. The rooms were an average size and had a microwave and refrigerator (both clean). The hotel served free cookies, coffee and tea every night. The price was great and we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Run Away and Don't Look Back!

reviews.text: The Sleep Inn was great. The room smelled nice and it was clean and well cared for. We had a microwave and a fridge. The sink was outside the bathroom/shower. We like that arrangement as it allows more flexibility for a couple cleaning up. The walk in shower enclosure was nicer than the typical tub/shower combo. The location was easy - near the mall and close to downtown and Hood College. We will return.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and a good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed her one night. The location is in a shopping and restaurant area so provided us many options for dining. The room was very clean; the bed comfortable. This hotel is a great option for travelers on a budget.
reviews.title: Great location; nice hotel for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sleep Inn for two nights during a trip to nearby Hollywood Casino. The hotel was next to a major shopping mall and close to restaurants. The room was very comfortable with a mini refrigerator and sitting area. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and the service staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Good value, clean, and convenient

reviews.text: Great stop on the way to DC. About an hour away. Had researched the hotel on-line and was pleased to see the information found cooresponded with the real thing. The reception desk was welcoming and helpful in guiding us to a restaurant near-by and not one of the many chain options but something a bit more unique and fun.
reviews.title: Maine to Maryland

reviews.text: Had a very nice stay and a good sleep. Room was nice and clean,and staff was friendly. I left one of my cards i got to reward a young man at the desk.
reviews.title: Good Sleep at Sleep Inn

reviews.text: This was a decent hotel although I probably wouldn't pay the same amount to stay there again. The rooms were average-sized. There is a vanity area and the bathroom has the toilet and a large walk-in shower. Really liked the shower but the lighting in the bathroom is very dim (there is a separate light in the shower, which was okay). There is also a heavy sliding door which was kind of hard to maneuver sometimes. I ended up using my own hairdryer since the one there was tiny and inadequate. Room was clean and smelled fine. The inside pool was what you'd expect, there are towels there which was nice.
reviews.title: It was okay, beds nice, horribly unfriendly desk clerk

likes.disliked: — Unfriendly and depressed check-in clerk (others later were nice)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was the usual, liked the apple and orange juice options. Also had make-your-own waffles, although everyone kept burning them. The free USA Today in the breakfast room was a bonus.
reviews.title: Nice Affordable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negative - the most unfriendly desk clerk I've EVER encountered, a man who never once looked up and spoke like he had a recording and was being forced to work there under duress. Maybe he was a resentful weekend worked or something, but he is obviously very unhappy with his job. It was so bad with each person that everyone in line started secretly looking at each other with incredulous looks. One man finally tried to make a light joke about something to lighten the depressing welcome and the man ignored him. It was very weird and made us initially nervous about our stay. While we were waiting, an elderly lady came up to the desk and, very nicely, indicated that her bathroom light was out. His response was something along the line of "what do you want me to do about it?". The lady didn't know what to do. The lighting is already bad and the bathroom would be pitch black. My husband found a maintenance person for her who didn't speak English but got the message across and he helped the lady.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: The carpet in the halls and rooms is very ugly and frayed, and our hallway on the third floor smelled like smoke (the room was fine though). It would be ncie if they would update that - the overall look is starting to appear a little worn.
reviews.title: Decent Budget Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel two years in a row while visiting Williamsburg. The first time we booked online and the second time we used one of those travel coupons., so we got a really good deal. It is centrally located close to all Williamsburg attractions and restaurants and close to Jamestown and Yorktown too. The location is also very quiet. It looks likes the rooms have been newly remodeled and were very clean. There is a stand up shower only, no bathtub. They have a nice lobby and a roomy breakfast area. There was the standard continental breakfast food. I especially liked the fresh fruit. They also had a inside pool and fitness center that both looked nice, although we didn't use them. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Left after 10 minutes, never gave us a refund for the night

description: 84 Rooms. Conveniently located less than two miles from historic downtown Frederick. Located off I-270 at Route 85, exit 31A and off I-70 at Route 355, exit 54. HOT complimentary Morning Medley Breakfast served from 6-10AM with extended weekend hours. Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel. Complimentary use of 24 hour fitness center. Hotel is located with-in walking distance to numerous restaurants as well as the Francis Scott Key Mall.
